citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) states that annual visits by the attending veterinarian will be made to the
facility. The licensee stated it had been approximately 1 1/2 years since the attending veterinarians last visit.
Each exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending
veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include regularly scheduled visits to the premises
of the exhibitor to ensure adequacy of care for the animals held at the facility.
Ensure the attending veterinarian visits the facility, at a minimum, as often as written in the PVC.

The primary enclosure housing two bull reindeer has a fence running down the middle of the outside pasture. This fence
runs approximately 3/4 of the length of the pasture, and can be used to separate animals. The end of the fence that is
nearest to the barn has an area at the top that has pulled away from the fence post, and has sharp points.
Outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from
injury.
Maintain all fencing so that it is sound and in good repair.
This is a1st Re-License Inspection for a Class "C" license.
The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 27, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Conducting regulated activities without a license is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
End Section
